title: POLICE: Jacksonville dad impaired when child finds gun and shoots self in hand
content:
Police say a father was impaired when his young son found a gun in a tackle box and shot his own hand.
Jacksonville police arrested Kenneth Anderson on Sunday for leaving a loaded semi-automatic pistol in the same room with his three year old.
Police say the child found the gun in a tackle box, and it went off, hitting the youngster in the hand.
The father was impaired, but took full responsibility for the weapon being left unsecured, according to police.
The 22-year-old was charged with failing to store the gun to protect a child, contributing to the delinquency of a juvenile and felony child negligent causing serious bodily injury.
He was jailed on a $25,000 bond.
Court records show Anderson is due in court November 3rd.
